item.description:
BioScience Academy Information Session

Thursday, May 24 2012
3:00 pm – 4:00 pm

 

Type of EventEducation Events

Category N/A (View All)

Committee N/A (View All)

Location: Gilmore Building, 801 Albany St, Boston, MA (Corner of Albany & Northampton Streets

Download the BioScience Academy Flyer here.

Program Offers

  • Biotechnology lab training
  • Two semesters of study

(Sep-May):

Fall: Mon–Thu, 9 a.m.–3 p.m.

Spring: Full-time internship & one evening course

  • 12 BU undergraduate credits,tuition supported
  • Certificate in Applied Biotechnology
  • Job search assistance

Admission Requires 

  • Unemployed or underemployed resident of greater Boston
  • Associate’s degree ( Bachelor’s Preferred) in science, technology, engineering, or math (STEM)
  • Two years STEM work experience
  • Legal authorization to work in USA
  • Passing score on BSA math test

 

INFORMATION SESSION DATES*
Thursdays, 3–4 p.m.
May 3, May 24, June 7
 
MATH ENTRANCE TEST DATES*
Tuesdays, 3-4 p.m.
May 1, May 15, May 29, June 12

*Registration is required for both information sessions and testing. Both are held at Gilmore Building, 801 Albany St, Boston, MA (Corner of Albany & Northampton Streets).
To sign up, email biosci@bu.edu

To download a math entrance test booklet and application form, visit:

www.bu.edu/BioSci
item.name: BioScience Academy Information Session
